pt.pa.model

Class GraphModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.pa.Observer.Subject
      • pt.pa.model.GraphModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Originator, Observable

    public class GraphModel
extends Subject
implements Originator
    The model of our MVC pattern, it contains all the logical data required and necessary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphModel(boolean type)
      Constructor of our class it simply initializes our graph

      This method inserts the data(related to the amount of Edges) we obtained from reading our dataset into the distances graph
      Graph<Hub,Route> createGraph(Vertex<Hub> origin, Vertex<Hub> dest)
      This method will create a graph that is actually a subgraph(if there are more than 1 subgraph inside the graph) so that the Dijkstra's algorithm code that was taught in class, this way the algorithm won't break down and every other subgraph outside is meaningless since their value values will be infinite (impossible to reach), and they arent necessary for the tasks asked in this project
      Memento createMemento()
      Method that returns a new Memento with the purpose to be stored on the Caretaker
      Graph<Hub,Route> createMiniGraph(Graph<Hub,Route> newGraph, java.util.List<Vertex<Hub>> visited)
      This method will create a graph where it ignores any vertex that would be value infinite in Dijkstra, those vertexes can be neglected since they are impossible to ever be one of the solutions in determining the lowest cost path

      • dijkstra

        public DijkstraResult<Hub> dijkstra(Vertex<Hub> hub1,
                                    Vertex<Hub> hub2)
                             throws Alerts
        Method to obtain the result of the Dijkstra algorithm
        Parameters:
        hub1 - The hub vertex that will be considered the origin of Dijkstra's algorithm
        hub2 - The hub vertex that will be considered the destination of Dijkstra's algorithm
        Returns:
        returns the result after the algorithm has been implemented
        Throws:
        Alerts - Throws an Alert in case something goes wrong in the following auxiliary methods

      • createGraph

        public Graph<Hub,Route> createGraph(Vertex<Hub> origin,
                                    Vertex<Hub> dest)
                             throws Alerts
        This method will create a graph that is actually a subgraph(if there are more than 1 subgraph inside the graph) so that the Dijkstra's algorithm code that was taught in class, this way the algorithm won't break down and every other subgraph outside is meaningless since their value values will be infinite (impossible to reach), and they arent necessary for the tasks asked in this project
        Parameters:
        origin - The hub vertex that will be considered the origin of Dijkstra's algorithm
        dest - The hub vertex that will be considered the destination of Dijkstra's algorithm
        Returns:
        returns the graph that will be used on Dijkstra's algorithm
        Throws:
        Alerts - Throws an Alert in case something goes wrong in the following auxiliary methods

      • availableVertexesForDijkstra

        public java.util.List<Vertex<Hub>> availableVertexesForDijkstra(Vertex<Hub> origin,
                                                                Vertex<Hub> dest)
                                                         throws Alerts
        This method find all available methods for to be rin on Dijkstra
        Parameters:
        origin - The hub vertex that will be considered the origin of Dijkstra's algorithm
        dest - The hub vertex that will be considered the destination of Dijkstra's algorithm
        Returns:
        returns the list of all possible vertexes the algorithm can path through
        Throws:
        Alerts - Throws an Alert in case something goes wrong

      • createMiniGraph

        public Graph<Hub,Route> createMiniGraph(Graph<Hub,Route> newGraph,
                                        java.util.List<Vertex<Hub>> visited)
        This method will create a graph where it ignores any vertex that would be value infinite in Dijkstra, those vertexes can be neglected since they are impossible to ever be one of the solutions in determining the lowest cost path
        Parameters:
        newGraph - the subgraph where all the vertexes are located
        visited - all the vertexes that can be visited
        Returns:
        return a graph so that we can use it to apply the dijkstra algorithm

      • applyBFS

        public java.util.List<Vertex<Hub>> applyBFS(Vertex<Hub> vert,
                                            int counter)
        This method will be called whenever we want to apply the BFS algorithm to a certain vertex
        Parameters:
        vert - vertex of origin
        counter - number of levels we will iterate our bfs
        Returns:
        returns the result of the BFS application
